website_summaries.verdict: This tandem stroller features a convertible design that offers a mind-boggling 27 ways to ride. A great choice if you're torn between seating configurations.
pros: Two reclining seats accommodate two infants or toddlers
Rear seat is removable, allowing older kids to sit on the bench or stand on the platform
Features two extra rear wheels for superior maneuverability
Accepts Graco Click Connect car seats
A multitude of seating configurations suits just about any family
cons: Additional wheels can be somewhat noisy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile but HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: super versatile! Easy to open and close. Confortable for both baby and toddler. Fits good on Honda CRV. Easy and smooth to push. Cons: HEAVY! I have to struggle when carrying this inside and outside my car’s trunk. My 2.8y/o toddler is too tight inside that’s why she prefers only the standing/sitting platform. There are better and lighter options for double stroller with only that platform.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. IVETTE

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept..yes. you have 27 ways to put your kids.. I have a 3 month old and five year old. I was planning on using this for travel (one seat, and bench for older kid) this thing is HUUUUGE and so heavy (42 lbs) the frame itself is of heavy metal.. they could've made it lighter for sure! I couldn't even lift it! I don't even think it will fit in a trunk! I returned this and stayed with my Joovy Caboose ultralight
customer_reviews.author: NELWERR

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy stroller with a 3.5 year old and a newborn. We've had it for a little while now and it's held up great. My only issue is due to the plastic wheels it can be a bit nosier than anticipated. Overall this helps hauling two boys very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! It makes me happy ever time I use it. I have a 1 year & a 3 year old & it works perfect for us. If I could change anything, I would make the storage space more accessible and add another adult cup holder, but overall the stroller works great for our needs and my girls enjoy riding it in. It’s also a little heavy for lifting in and out of the car, but I manage. Overall, I’m very happy with my purchase, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Barber

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I have a 2 year old and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have a 2 year old and a newborn, plenty of space for each without being huge. We took the bench seat off for now because my 2 year old still uses the full seat. If both are connected it makes it hard to fit anything in the storage underneath. Not a huge fan of the plastic wheels but it handles great despite them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge, Heavy Loud and Bumpy
customer_reviews.text: My title says it all. It’s so big it’s embarrassing, it definitely calls attention and it won’t fit in most sedan trunks. So heavy I think even the average man would have trouble lifting this up and down stairs or into a trunk. It’s extremely loud and bumpy if you’re using it on a sidewalk. The slightest crack or bump on the floor sends my newborn flying and she starts crying. I honestly don’t think it’s even safe unlees your babies are older. Also the toddler seats are too small for my son who just turned 3 so those are useless to us. Only positive is it’s got lots of storage space
customer_reviews.author: mango

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller HORRIBLE WHEELS
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I found this stroller. I love all the different options you can use and how easy it is to get the car seat in and out. So I was REALLY DISAPPOINTED that they put crap plastic wheels on it!! There is NO suspension whatsoever and you can not push it over gravel, sand, gras, bumps, curbs, or uneven pavement! Why would you not put different wheels on it!? I am returning because of the stupid wheels!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Curtis

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY!!! HUGE Stroller, Hard to Navigate
customer_reviews.text: Super HEAVY and the kids are kicking each other. Basket on Bottom impossible to store things in as you can't access it without removing the kids. Hard to steer thru crosswalks and sidewalks. Definitely too large for Cabs, Bus, Shopping. Won't fit in a regular car trunk, even when folded. Folding doesn't do much to eliminate the size of this monster.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this to anyone. First of all my toddler (2 years old) barely fits in the seat... his head hits the top of the seat and is uncomfortable in it. (He is average height and weight for a 2 year old). Secondly I took this stroller out for the first time just for a quick walk down my paved street and when I got back one of the wheels had a crack in it from just ONE USE. It’s still usable but i think that’s a bit ridiculous. The stroller itself is also very heavy and annoying to fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Versatile two seater.
customer_reviews.text: Very good stroller. We have a two year old and a newborn so the Graco infant carrier clicked right in. We attempted to click in the Graco modes single seater (seat was more plush, two cup holders and tray) but it was not compatible). Also only one parent cup holder and no parent tray. Although two built in cup holders mounted mid stroller and one cup holder for each seat, but no trays. A lot of storage down below. Stroller has pros and con but definitely worth the extra cost for the compatibility with the infant carrier. Can feel the extra length but still handles and steers well.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great double stroller
customer_reviews.text: We were looking into double strollers, and the reason we liked this one so much was that it was convertible over time. I love that you can click a baby carrier into it (we have our second son due in just a few weeks) and we've practiced with it around the neighborhood. It folds really easily, but it is kind of bulky- however, this doesn't shock me because it's a double stroller, so of course it is.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Grace

customer_reviews.title: Toddler seats way too small!
customer_reviews.text: Versatile and easy to use but had to return it after 1 day because the toddler seats are so small my 37” tall toddler who is not quite 3 years old. She’s only in the 50th percentile or so for height and weight. The back of her head was resting on the metal seat frame rather than below it where it should be.
customer_reviews.author: zaarmstrong

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE STROLLER
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to enjoy this stroller but simply couldn’t. I kept it for 2 weeks trying to like it. First, my 15 month old couldn’t even sit in the seat comfortably. The foot rest of the seats were not designed well as they rested behind the natural laying foot position of my child in the seat. Secondly, this stroller is extremely loud from the wheels and I couldn’t even have a conversation while walking. I sent the stroller back and purchased the Baby Trend double jogging stroller and couldn’t be more pleased. Poor stroller. Would not suggest it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Tons of seating options. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Has more options than other strollers we looked at. I found that it is much easier to fold with the baby cupholder bars removed. Very functional. Comes with great assembly instructions. I put it together by myself with no tools in less than 20 minutes. The stroller is easy to manuever with just one hand and turns very easy which was great for trying to get out the front door of the house without anyone to help me. Don't be scared off this buggy by the handful of negative reviews. I think some people just look for stuff to complain about. The stroller even pushed just fine on my gravel driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two young kids
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after our second child was born, so far it's been great for all the outings we've used it for - the beach, the zoo, just walking around the block. It's super convenient for my 2 year old daughter - we love having her to be able to sit or stand without a ton of rearranging. It is fairly big, so make sure if you intend on traveling with it that your vehicle can hold it - but that wasn't unexpected for us given what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: J. Durolek

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old (whom is a small girl)did not fit under the canopies as soon we got this. Very disappointed. I d say up to 2 years old can sit in the seats after that only in the standing area. I had to return this because of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn ann harris

customer_reviews.title: Meets the new disney world requirements.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace our Chico double with a new baby on the way and a whole slew of Grace infant car seats/bases from our youngest child still in date. It’s inaugural trip was to Disney world, where it meets their dimensions for strollers and takes up much less space open (and closed) than a side by side. Great storage underneath and plenty of cup holders to keep everyone hydrated. Could use one more zipper pouch up near the handles, but we added our own (Disney themed) stroller bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Oct 23, 2018 Loveeee the stroller, I have an almost two year old & a 2 month old. The stroller is pretty sturdy. Reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars is because it is a little heavy, I have a Ford Expedition so it fits fine in my trunk but wouldn’t fit in a small car. Update: Feb 22, 2019 I ended up returning the stroller, because it was to heavy for me to put and take out the car! I’m 5’1. And I had to remove the seats to fold. I really loved the stroller but it was to complicated for me. Specially with an 19 & 5 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Aguilera

customer_reviews.title: Almost prefect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller, it hold both my kids right now without an issue. We are currently using one seat and the other is our graco infant car seat. It rolls great and the step pad on the back is awesome. Would have given it 5 stars but you have to remove the seats to fold it up, making you have to put it together every time you have to take it in and out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. Don’t like the green trim that much for for the price difference in the colors I’ll take it. It was super easy to put together. Easy to push and pull and spin around. Love that I can do so many different seatings. So glad I got this over the side to side or the city select. Cons. Super super heavy even with the seats off. Basket is hard to get to. Seats don’t recline as far back as the single stroller. Wish they have the complete parent bar vs just a cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Carson

customer_reviews.title: Graco love forever.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. Baby is not here yet but my car seat from my son clicks right into the seat. My only complaint is that it is harder to get into the trunk of my Ford Escape because of the size. Apparently if you make the front seat the infant and the back the toddler it folds up smaller, however my toddler is 3 so that won’t work with his long legs. Overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Dibble

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac of strollers!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together! No tools needs. Read the instructions first and it'll only take 10 minutes to complete! So many seating opens, the seats lay back enough so that the kids can sleep/rest comfortably. The bottom basket it roomy, there's extra cup holders in between the seats. Kinda wish that was removable, but, THAT'S the ONLY complaint so far! Will update once baby is here and we're actively using it!
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Difficult, heavy, seats too small.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this stroller. So far it’s not the greatest. Mainly chose this one due to the higher child weight limit (up to 50 lbs) but my 40 pound toddler doesn’t fit in the reclining seats. Stroller is difficult to maneuver and I can barely get it over small bumps. Also there is no shock absorption so my infant gets whipped around if the sidewalk isn’t totally smooth. Do yourself a favor and pass on this super heavy stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing yet heavy
customer_reviews.text: Okay I read a lot of reviews before I made my decision to buy. I will say it is true this weighs a lot! It’s easy to fold sometimes the wheels are in the wrong position but other than that simple. Putting it together was fun not going to lie. I use it to go on my walks I walk six miles daily although sometimes it’s only 3. I figured out to make the toddler recline all the way down the bottom one must be facing towards you if not the bar stops it from reclining the whole way.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent stroller. Rolls smoothly
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent stroller. Rolls smoothly; wheels never get twisted. It's surprisingly lighter than I anticipated. The best thing is the versatility. There are 27 configurations that all makes sense. Good product, with an even better design.
customer_reviews.author: Vallos

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite stroller I’ve ever used. It’s easy to move and to fold and unfold. I love being able to put my older child in the back or front. If where somewhere where She is getting on and off we do the sit or stand option if she is just looking, won’t be getting down a lot or my need to lay down for a nap we use the seat. And then I just put my other child in her car seat in the other location. I can’t say enough about it
customer_reviews.author: Courtney M Oler

customer_reviews.title: A great inline double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to push, assemble. Incredibly versatile. Many options for the ride. I can have both seats facing each other for my twins to interact Cons: only thing is you have to take the seats out to close it... but it's so simple to slide off that it's not a huge deal. It's a fair price to pay when you have so many options with how the seats are.
customer_reviews.author: Br

customer_reviews.title: Tons of ways to position
customer_reviews.text: I love all the ways you can have this stroller. My only take backs are the wheels are kinda slippery and tend to slip sideways. Also I can’t fold the thing for the life of me with one seat on. My husband has it down to a science but without him I can never do it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this stroller so much! The seats are too small for my 2.5yo. her head touches the sun shade. If she's napping, her head hits the partion bar in the center which is so dangerous!. I wish I could return this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great for my twins. They have lots of room. Love that the seats can face each other. The basket underneath is large. Tons of cup holders. The only downfall is the extra bar at the top, in the canopy. If you have taller kiddos it definitely would t be the best choice. Otherwise it’s great!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess5

customer_reviews.title: Great for two toddlers
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our granddaughter who has 1 and 2 year old toddler girls. Everyone loves this stroller, even the babies! It's easy to maneuver and has enough storage room for everything a busy mom would need to take along on a walk. I also like all the different riding positions available that will be good as the kids grow. A bit more leg room in the front would be nice, but overall it was a great purchase to value, and just what our family needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: my 2 year old does not fit there any more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily treks over grass. Click connect car seat compatible. Plenty of cup holders.
customer_reviews.text: The loud noise review holds 100% true but it is what it is and doesn’t take away from the actual functionality of the stroller. Huge bottom basket, holds all of our baggage and belongings. Love that I can still use my click connect car seat for my infant baby and that my toddler still has a comfortable seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love the stroller. Only issue I had was that it was shipped to me with an extremely damaged box and parts were missing. I had to ask for a partial refund as the parts couldn’t be sent to me from amazon. Luckily it was under the 1yr warranty from the time I bought it and graco replaced the parts free of charge. Other than that small hiccup it is an amazing stroller. Little small for my older child but even he loves the stroller. It works with my youngest son’s car seat and allows it to directly click into it which is a godsend and why I bought this stroller in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Grimsley

customer_reviews.title: Good but loud
customer_reviews.text: For the price point it’s a nice stroller. The seats are not very tall so an older toddler probably won’t fit well. Also the little extra wheels are horrible! SO loud and pointless. I had a friend remove them, which was incredibly difficult but now I love the stroller so much more. It’s definitely heavier and longer than the nicer, more expensive brands but for the price point you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this stroller is that it is really noisy. The base plate where the child stands rattles A LOT when no child is on it. I had to take the base plate off because it was annoying me so much. I love the handle height because I am 5'9" It folds well, but you have to take the seats off for it to fold completely. They are easy to take off so that's not a big problem. My kids are on the larger side and they fit quite comfortably in this stroller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A product that will be used for years to come!
customer_reviews.text: Best stroller I’ve ever had! My children are 19 months apart and we use this everywhere! Amusement parks, Zoos, and even grocery stores! One of my favorite things about the stroller are the 5 cup holders! It is just a well thought out product. When our daughter was a newborn, her click n connect snug ride clicked fit wonderfully. Although, it did take time to get it to click into the stroller. We will be using this for years to come! Graco customers for life!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my newborn twins. This product is of a great quality. Looks classy and moves well. Easy to assemble, fold, unfold and move around. Fits well into my car trunk. Multiple modes options is amazing.. i already tried a few ways to fit in my twins into it and they loved it. Am glad we picked this.. this is going to stay as along as my kids want to stroll!
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a second stroller to keep at my Parents when we travel there by plane. It fit fits our toddler and infant well but when folded it takes up half the cargo area of a mid-size SUV. Overall is a good stroller especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Best stroller I have ever owned. I love it I can click a carseat into it and have my toddler sit either facing forward or at me either way. When both kids are older there are so many more ways to seat them I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Great product great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It is big when you get it set up but when you have two little ones it is like moving. You have a lot of room to put a lot of things in . Great for a long day outing.
customer_reviews.author: pap

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Life saver when it comes to having an 11 month old and a newborn. I love all the riding options. Fits nicely in the back of my car (Kia Soul), even though it takes up the whole back. I sometimes have difficulty folding it down, the front wheels get turned backwards and makes it difficult to latch but I’m learning to remember to keep them forward and have no issues. Little heavy but it does hold two babies.
customer_reviews.author: Kate A. Taulbee

customer_reviews.title: Stout, but not great for taller toddlers / kids
customer_reviews.text: In fairness, I didn’t get this stroller out of the house. I got it with the intention of using it with a newborn and a taller toddler (3). While it is stout and sturdy, it is not suited for taller kids. My daughter is ~38”, and she had to hold her head cocked to one side to try and fit. I hesitated to purchase in the first place, as there were lots of concerns about noise. After viewing a video on Amazon, I pulled the trigger and didn’t notice it to be too noisy while assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Cory C.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My click connect car seat works in it all ways ! I’m so in love. 1.5 months till my second born is here !!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not noisy if you have kids in it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! Our 3 year old is a bit big for the seats that come with it but she can sit in them if she needed to but she loves the little bench seat or standing up too! I read a lot of complaints that it’s a noisy stroller and sure it rattles a little on like asphalt. But if I have both kids in it and the diaper bag I think the weight stops it from rattling. It folds easy and steering it is easy! We have a Disney trip planned for the end of the year and I think this will be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, loud wheels
customer_reviews.text: Folds away and opens easily. Accommodates 2 children nicely and so much versatility. My ONLY complaint is the 2 smaller caster wheels on the back end where the older child can sit or stand are very loud. Trying to find a way to remove them because they are so distracting. Can hardly hear the person talking next to me.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: Okay - good functionality bad tires
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the seating combinations are nice on this and fits well through doors when in the city. However, the plastic stroller wheels and the two small additional wheels for the toddler spot make it not feasible for walking outside, in neighborhoods or on trails. The small wheel clang and are very noisy. I wouldn't buy this again as we walk outside on sidewalks nightly but no longer use this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stroller but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Nice stroller, but you buy the seats, very expensive, I just hope it's worth what I paid for it. Will add on to review after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Totten

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is heavy and hard to push ! And tit make noise when you push outside . The front seat is so small my 18 month old fit but can't move her arms! I'm going to return it
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are cheap plastic and really loud when using. Lots of cargo space. Fairly lightweight for a double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing I love thos stroller. The best part hands down is the seating. It has so many options that works with so many outings. I love that it has so much storage. Is easier to push than all other double strollers o have used. Easy to put away and put up.SO MANY cupholders. And both kids can lay down no matter the seating.
customer_reviews.author: Shanban

customer_reviews.title: I do like the stroller however it's really hard to lift up ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like the stroller however it's really hard to lift up to get into the back of the van big and bulky but actually on the smaller side for most of the strollers
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ganovsky

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller for twins. It's just huge. Only thing I absolutely HATE is that getting access to the storage underneath is the worst. You have to remove a carseat or baby to get to whatever you need under. It is the worst design ever. Other than that I love that I can put the seats in any facing direction. And it is a smooth push
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Fallivene

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. Good pricing. A bit on the heavy side tho. The wheels are not loud. Made from plastic and rubber
customer_reviews.author: Pao Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is so freaking heavy it is almost unusable. I wish I just would have bought a stroller just for the infant seats, because The seats to this stroller are incredibly difficult to fasten. And when you are dealing with two kids it is beyond frustrating. I hate this stroller. The only good quality it has is maneuverability. Other than that it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina M

customer_reviews.title: Good stoller but large
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room and you can connect graco car seat to it but it’s very bulky and takes up lots of room when it’s foldered up. The stoller will pretty much take up my whole trunk when I start using both seats. Good stroller for 2 kids but it’s big.
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue

customer_reviews.title: So worth that price
customer_reviews.text: SUCH a great stroller. I have 2 toddlers and it moves like a dream. Worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Waddington

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this product after reading all the reviews, but so far I love it! It is a bit noisy, but I'll take that for all the other amazing benefits this stroller has. The basket is very roomy, my son (2 years old) loves the toddler seat and my 3 month old fits perfectly. It has definitely made my life easier!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Landers

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like that i can use the graco carseat with this but i feep it is super heavy and bulky making it hard cor me to get it in and out of my yukon with me being short. My middle two kids seem to like it, i won't be using it more until i have my youngest next month and i can decide more if i like it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda hillious

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller for two!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller and everything about it. It maneuvers well and my son looks comfortable sitting in the stroller. Will be perfect for when my daughter arrives!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Get it if it’s on sale
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy but I’m able to fit it in my small trunk when i take the seat off and it is very fast and easy to put the seat back on when I’m ready to use it. My safety 1st infant car seat does not click into place though which is upsetting because i had read it was supposed to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this stroller. The smaller wheels are very very loud and feels unsteady on all surfaces. Very uncomfortable ride for baby and toddler. I TOTALLY regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Garnell R.

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. Assembly does take time, and the stroller itself is heavier than I expected. But keep in mind you are able to seat two and do a lot more than just being able to seat one child! Worth the money. Love this stroller
customer_reviews.author: T Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Easy but difficult
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put this together by myself at 38 weeks pregnant. Super easy to put together just a pain to attempt to fold. Once you get use to how to position the seats it because easier but it definitely takes some practice.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I have a newborn and a 3 year old and they fit nicely. The only backdraw on it is that it is a little long .. but it’s strong and really durable I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: victor gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I love our new Graco stroller, its so easy to assemble, very sturdy and easy to use. Both my children love it and I can't stress enough how helpful its been to me overall, definitely recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Esperanza G. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stroller. I had a contour years ago that was similar. I have a two under two and it's the best stroller I've used since the contour, which is double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste F

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS STROLLER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love all the seating options and easily folds down and fits in the back of our Jeep Patriot.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Pulley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We previously owned a Graco Modes single stroller and loved it. So, when we had our second child in December, I knew I wanted a Graco Modes Double Strolled. The assembly was straightforward and it seem well made. However, after only a few walks outside, the wheels are now bare!! I’m SO disappointed. It’s not even summer and this stroller now slides all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: George Elias

customer_reviews.title: It’s long but does the trick! Much better than a side by side
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller fir two babies; one 20 month old and one 2 month old!!
customer_reviews.author: elf

customer_reviews.title: Brake stopped working after a couple months..
customer_reviews.text: Loved the stroller but we've only been using it for a couple months and the brake no longer works so it's pretty unsafe now if I ever have to let go of it.m
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Double Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Beware, its big....but thats expected with a double stroller. My 2 yr old really likes it. I like that i can configure it differently, depending on the babies moods. People complain of the wheels being nosey. It doesnt bother me or the babies at all. When you are indoors you cant even hear it. I highly recommend this stroller
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kit

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient. Fits my 18 month old and newborn perfectly. I love the many seating options. It is pretty heavy to lift in and out of my van.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Seats too small for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with our click connect car seat. Hard to click into place. Takes quite a bit of maneuvering and jostling to get it to latch. The toddler seats are way too narrow/shallow for my 2.5 year old. He’s 33lbs. The canopy is also too short. I’m going to try another configuration option for him. Also loud when pushing on the sidewalks. Not overly thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. If your looking for the noisest stroller in the entire world then this is the stroller for you. The only place this thing belongs is in the garbage. Extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.author: SFN

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty big stroller
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty big stroller. I call it the Cadillac Stroller. But it maneuvers pretty well. It's not the lightest stroller in the world, but not the heaviest either.
customer_reviews.author: bruteforce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 new grand babies and this is perfect! Easy to use and folds up easily to fit in the car. A total life saver.
customer_reviews.author: linda blaksley

customer_reviews.title: This family loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We use it tons, love all the options for riding! It is little heavy an fairly big but we make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Bennitia Burton

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Honestly aggravated with this stroller. Wife and I struggle locking the bases in this stroller. It is designed badly and NOT easy to put the babies in. I feel like they actually didnt test this with 2 infants in car seats? Hard pass my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great option for a big kid and an infant
customer_reviews.text: I love it.. my three year old fits it’s easy to push.. and great price on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mosi

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stroller!!! Steers great in tight spots. Easy fold for storage. A little heavy for my wife who just gave birth but other than that this is exactly what we looked forward to. Assembly took a little longer than expected but once complete it looks nice feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Helped my sister out
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother as a baby shower gift for their second child and he is in the army. My sister in las Say’s that it has been a game changer For travel. It folds really small for planes and super quick to close when she has to do it alone with the two girls.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's kind of heavy for me to lift by myself but I mange load it but I still will give it 5 star cause it's worth the struggle at least for me. My kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Letty

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well made I only wish the wheels or rubber instead of hard plastic
customer_reviews.author: Mike DeLaurenzo

customer_reviews.title: Always use the brake
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is easy to move while in use even in the snow. I love the canopy seats very good for the type of weather in Colorado. My kids love it. Easy to adjust the seats. And so many positions on how to use the seats. It also has a brake that’s is really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Adile Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Bad shipping due to box having holes in it. Was hard to gift wrap because of it
customer_reviews.author: danielle giannini

customer_reviews.title: Good features but not highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good design features. Not easy to fold or collapse. Difficult to turn and maneuver while carriage has children in their seats. Not a smooth ride - for children nor for person pushing stroller. Not a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great steering, lots of room for storage
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is large but fits into our fusion’s trunk. Great steering , lots of room for storage , and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have any trays.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller does not have trays. It is super bulky folded up with both toddler seats. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well,  little heavy, and not fireproof
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller however it is a little on the heavy side though. And this stroller will not survive a house fire. While we had it, we enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: jonfero

customer_reviews.title: Duo Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Loved it but would have been better if it would allow you to have the seats face each other. Also it would be better with bigger wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S

customer_reviews.title: Good and versatile but takes up space!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great double stroller. The only thing is it does take up a lot of space in your trunk and I have a van. It’s requires 2 hands to fold.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is too small. My 1 year old barely fits in the seat. The infant car seat is extremely hard to get connected. Worst purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby J. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fits my graco carseat so I dont have to disturb my newborn! and so many combinations....
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: it takes a lot of space in a car
customer_reviews.text: I wish it could be less in dimension both open and assembled. Its too big and takes a lot of space in a car. If you take it with you for shopping forget about a proper shopping as it takes nearly all space of your car (mine is SUV).
customer_reviews.author: Anar H

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for my twins, they love the ride and the fact that it reclines so they can lay down while I push.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: We love it! It’s great to be able to have the seats in so many different positions. Works great for our Graco Click Connect bucket seat. Our toddler can’t wait for baby sister to arrive so they can go on walks!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its not a good product
customer_reviews.text: In one word, its did not fulfill my requirements, plus what i saw online its was not same as online.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: The seller !!!
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is nice and easy to move around . The thing I disliked was the seller ledeira so un professional and send the product with missing items and used wheels . I definitely don’t recommend the seller.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good item for 2 babies. Good handling, easy to fold. But very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Graco Modes Duo Double Stroller | 27 Riding Options for 2 Kids, Basin
product_meta.description:
Color:BasinThe Graco Modes Duo double stroller is extremely versatile! With 27 riding options, from infant to youth, you can configure this stroller for the best fit for your growing family. The Graco Modes Duo Stroller accepts TWO Graco Click Connect Infant Car Seats, connecting with a secure one-step attachment. It has a standing platform and bench seat for your older child, and two reclining, removable seats that allow for stroller customization. Convenience and comfort features include locking front swivel wheels for increased maneuverability, extra platform wheels, one-handed standing fold, and pivoting child's arm bar with cupholders. The Graco Modes Duo Stroller helps you get the most out of every ride!. To clean stroller frame and seat pad, spot clean using mild soap and warm water. Never use bleach. Use light oil if wheels squeak. Child Occupancy Max: 2, Front Seat: Up to 50 lb, Rear Seat: Up to 50 lb. Folded Height- 50.5 inches Folded Width- 24 inches.

SPECIFICATIONS: Stroller Depth: 46 inches; Stroller Weight: 42 pounds; Stroller Width: 25.5 inches; Stroller Height: 45 inches; Stroller Rear Wheel Size: 8.5 inches; Stroller Front Wheel Size: 7.5 inches.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Graco Modes Duo Double Stroller in Basin color | 2 Removable seats with trays and cup holders

Stroller dimensions – 46” L x 25.5" W x 45" H | Seat space – 7.5” | Seat back – 17” | Stroller weight – 42 lbs. | Front/Rear seat max hold weight (each) – 50 lbs. | Rear wheel size – 8.5” | Front Wheel Size – 7.5”
Accepts two Graco Snug Ride Click Connect Infant Car Seats
27 riding options for two children from infant to youth, including bench seat and standing platform options
One-hand, standing fold with storage latch folds with seats on or off to make stowing and going easy for parents

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars436 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
